title: Ticket #2639: # in ALLOW_READ list spams nameserver
description:
A user had something like the following in their configuration file: 

ALLOW_READ = foo.example.com, bar.example.com #, qux.example.com

(You can see the exact configuration in condor-admin 22800 )

This assumes that foo, bar, and qux are actual hostnames.

The intent is to comment out qux.example.com. This doesn't work; comments are only valid is # is the first non-whitespace character in the line. So Condor included qux, as well as "#" as a hostname. This wouldn't have been too bad, but the user reports: "condor suddenly polls our nameservers for a host named "#" at a rather high rate (roughly 1000 requests per minute)."

It is highly likely that other invalid hostnames, possibly all non-resolving hostnames, will cause the effect. Under no circumstances should we be spamming a nameserver repeated for a non-resolving address.

User is using Condor 7.6.4-1 from the squeeze repository http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/debian/ on Ubuntu Oneiric 11.10.
